January 319 1958
Dr. John R. Richards, Chancellor
Oregon State System of Higher Education
University of Oregon
Eugene, Oregon
Dear Chancellor Richards:
We of the National Association of Educational Broadcasters
were very surprised to learn that serious consideration is
being given to selling Radio Station KOAC in order to support
KOAC-TV. Although our Association is much Involved in all
aspects of educational television, we nevertheless believe that
radio should not be curtailed in order to support television.
Radio and television provide quite different services*
That is the reason radio remains such an Important medium of
communication, despite television®3 dramatic development in
recent years* Radioes program pattern, of course, has changed
in response to television^ competition* But in the educational
field, the in-school use of radio continues to grow; none of
the major "schools of the air" have been dropped because of
television, although they have adapted to television by empha¬
sizing programs of nonvlsual nature* For adult listeners, the
news, information and musical offerings of educational stations
have actually increased in importance, now that so many commercial
stations limit themselves to news-on-the-hour and disc Jockey
programs*
So much has been said about the effect of television on
radio, that it is often overlooked that the older medium is
currently expanding. There are more radio stations on the air
now than ever before; the number of radio receivers is
steadily increasing; and commercial radio income has risen
over last year9s level as advertisers realize the extent and
amount of radio listening*
The public hearings which will shortly be held to discuss
KOAC0 s future will undoubtedly bring forth evidence to support
the statements made above, so I shall not go into detail here.
But x*e of the National Association of Educational Broadcasters
stand ready to provide documentary proof of these contentions
if that should be necessary.
KOAC should not be the first of America®s major educational
radio stations to go off the air because of television!
Yours sincerely.
